title: Spack mirror documentation for 0.13.0 needs updated for the layout of the mirror directories and files

labels.name: snl-atdm
labels.description: Issues for SNL ATDM usage of spack

body:
CC: @fryeguy52 Tag: snl-atdm-issue Using Spack version 0.13.0 ... I am trying to use the `sparc mirror` command to copy tarballs for the sources for the packages that we need to use. The list of packages and versions that I need the add to my mirror are:
packages_to_get_tarballs_uniq.txt ``` autoconf@2.69 automake@1.16.1 binutils@2.31.1 boost@1.59.0 bzip2@1.0.8 cgns@snl-atdm cmake@3.15.4 curl@7.63.0 diffutils@3.7 expat@2.2.9 gcc@7.2.0 gdbm@1.18.1 gettext@0.20.1 git@2.20.1 gmp@6.1.2 hdf5@1.8.21 hwloc@1.11.11 isl@0.18 libbsd@0.9.1 libffi@3.2.1 libiconv@1.16 libpciaccess@0.13.5 libsigsegv@2.12 libtool@2.4.6 libxml2@2.9.9 m4@1.4.18 metis@5.1.0 mpc@1.1.0 mpfr@3.1.6 ncurses@6.1 netcdf@4.4.1 netlib-lapack@3.8.0 ninja-fortran@1.9.0.2.g99df1 numactl@2.0.12 openmpi@1.10.1 openssl@1.1.1d parallel-netcdf@1.11.2 parmetis@4.0.3 pcre@8.42 perl@5.26.2 perl@5.30.0 pkgconf@1.6.3 python@2.7.15 readline@8.0 sqlite@3.30.1 superlu-dist@5.4.0 superlu@4.3 tar@1.31 util-macros@1.19.1 xz@5.2.4 zlib@1.2.11 ```
(that list was NOT that easy to generate) I have a local mirror dir already configured in the `spack.yaml` file which is: ``` $ time ./atdm-spack/spack/bin/spack mirror list local_filesystem file:///ascldap/users/rabartl/Spack.base4/atdm-spack/atdm-spack-tarball-mirror real 0m3.152s user 0m3.014s sys 0m0.128s ``` But when I run: ``` $ ./atdm-spack/spack/bin/spack mirror create \ --file packages_to_get_tarballs_uniq.txt \ &> spack.mirror.out ``` I get the output:
spack.mirror.out ``` ==> Adding package autoconf@2.69 to mirror ==> Adding package automake@1.16.1 to mirror ==> Adding package binutils@2.31.1 to mirror ==> Adding package boost@1.59.0 to mirror ==> Adding package bzip2@1.0.8 to mirror ==> Adding package cgns@snl-atdm to mirror ==> Adding package cmake@3.15.4 to mirror ==> Adding package curl@7.63.0 to mirror ==> Adding package diffutils@3.7 to mirror ==> Adding package expat@2.2.9 to mirror ==> Adding package gcc@7.2.0 to mirror ==> Adding package gdbm@1.18.1 to mirror ==> Adding package gettext@0.20.1 to mirror ==> Adding package git@2.20.1 to mirror ==> Adding package gmp@6.1.2 to mirror ==> Adding package hdf5@1.8.21 to mirror ==> Using cached archive: /home/rabartl/Spack.base4/atdm-spack/spack/var/spack/cache/_source-cache/archive/57/57cee5ff1992b4098eda079815c36fc2da9b10e00a9056df054f2384c4fc7523 ==> Adding package hwloc@1.11.11 to mirror ==> package superlu@4.3 to mirror ==> Adding package tar@1.31 to mirror ==> Adding package util-macros@1.19.1 to mirror ==> Adding package xz@5.2.4 to mirror ==> Adding package zlib@1.2.11 to mirror ==> Successfully updated mirror in file:///home/rabartl/Spack.base4/atdm-spack/spack/var/spack/cache Archive stats: 51 already present 0 added 0 failed to fetch. ```
But when I look in my mirror, none of these files are actually getting copied to that directory. For example, there is no tarball for cmake-3.15.4, there is only the one for cmake-3.13.4 that I already had it there: ``` $ find /home/rabartl/Spack.base4/atdm-spack/atdm-spack-tarball-mirror/ -name "cmake-*" -type f /home/rabartl/Spack.base4/atdm-spack/atdm-spack-tarball-mirror/cmake/cmake-3.13.4.tar.gz ``` Where are these tarballs actually going? Looking in the directory: ``` /home/rabartl/Spack.base4/atdm-spack/spack/var/spack/cache/ ``` all I see is: ``` $ find /home/rabartl/Spack.base4/atdm-spack/spack/var/spack/cache -name "*.tar.gz"
